meanings.definition: To taste beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: She foretasted the soup to make sure it was seasoned correctly.
meanings.sent2: I foretasted the cake batter to check the sweetness.
meanings.sent3: Before the dinner party, she foretasted each dish to avoid any surprises.
meanings.sent4: He foretasted the success of his new business venture.
meanings.sent5: The chef foretasted the flavors in his mind before creating the dish.

meanings.definition: To have a taste or experience of beforehand.
meanings.sent1: They foretasted the excitement of the upcoming vacation.
meanings.sent2: She foretasted the joy of meeting her favorite author.
meanings.sent3: The children foretasted the fun of the amusement park all week.
meanings.sent4: He foretasted the thrill of skydiving before the actual jump.
meanings.sent5: The students foretasted the knowledge they would gain from the field trip.
